revised_title: Advances in Coelacanth Biology and Research
tldr: This review lecture discusses the advances in coelacanth research, including anatomy, biochemistry, and the discovery of living specimens. The lecture covers the history of coelacanth discoveries, the challenges of obtaining suitable samples, and the findings from the British-French-American Expedition to the Comoro Islands in 1972. The article highlights the importance of these ancient fish in understanding evolution and their role in marine biology.
